item.description:
Jabokni is a word game where two or more players draw playing pieces and place them on the board to form words. The first three playing pieces decide the order of the players and form the "word bank".

Each player, in turn, draws one playing piece, places it on the board and declares a word. The player scores one point per letter of the word declared. The other player(s) each declare a different word and score one point per letter of the declared word.

Play then passes to the next player and play ends when there are no more playing pieces left to play.

Jabokni consists of a board and fifteen articulated playing pieces. The playing pieces are designed so that any two playing pieces can be put together to form at least one word in the English language. The only other rules are that the playing piece laid must touch on at least two edges, the words declared on any one turn must use at least one letter from the playing piece last laid and that if the playing piece laid results in touching sets of half octagons, then the words declared must use at least one letter from each set of half octagons.

From the box:
The object of the game is to complete a score card by answering trivia questions from five different categories and be the first to cross the finish line with a completed score card. But watch out! You must avoid setbacks and potential disasters brought on by your opponents as they try to complete their score cards and cross the finish line before you.

name.value: Dungeons & Dragons: The Legend of Drizzt Board Game

item.description:
A cooperative game of adventure for 1-5 players set in the world of Dungeons & Dragons.

It is named after the book series by the same name recounting the adventures of the dark elf Drizzt Do'Urden and his friends.

Designed for 1-5 players, this boardgame features multiple scenarios, challenging quests, and cooperative game play. Players explore the game world, which is built during the game by laying out tiles, using ready-made player characters and encountering enemies with corresponding miniatures. Encounters are generated by drawing cards and resolved using a D20 die. All players win together, depending on the scenario, by escaping, saving others or overcoming a threat.

name.value: Strasbourg: The Age of the Guilds

item.description:
Strasbourg in the 15th century - the political skills of the city are heavily influenced by the craftsmen guilds .

In this time, players take on the lead of ascending families of the city. It is your goal to place your family members in the different guilds. Only the clever usage of influence points makes it possible to be accommodated as apprentice, assistant or even master craftsman - provided you can pay the admission fee. But don't underestimate the power of the church or the nobility.

Strasbourg is a easy to learn strategy game with inventive mechanisms, that provide the player with lots of room for decisions. But only those that also keep an eye on the plans of the other players will earn the highest fame in the end.

item.description: Enter the world of high finance and higher risk with the High Roller dice game. Players roll the dice in an effort to increase their fortunes and build their "budding" business. But in this game, danger awaits you at every turn and getting busted is just a roll of the dice away. Each player rolls two numbered dice (1-6) and one event dice with the event die determining what the numbers stand for, where even numbers equal good results and odd numbers equal bad results. The game contains two numbered dice, one event die, 100 chips and a rules card. Each player starts with 10 chips (their stash) with the remaining chips forming the pot, and the one with the biggest stash when the pot runs out wins.

item.description:
Yin Yang Koi is an abstract board game.
"Yin" and "Yang",two families of Koi were struggle for control of the pond.You can move your Koi, place your fry or flip fry from opposing side to your side.

Goal of the game
Placing a predetermined number of fryes to control the pond, and the winner is the player to reach the goal first.

Set Up
1)Lay out the board between two players.
2)Players choose a family, Yin or Yang.
3)Yin player take 5 Yin koies;Yang player take 5 Yang koies.
4)Player take turns to place a koi on any position of the board until all of them were placed.
5)Set aside all fryes near the board.

Overview of a game round
On your turn, you must move one of your pieces, then place your new counters and flip opposing's counters along the trail of that piece.When your turn is over, the opponent take his turns in the manner.

Game Play Details
Yin player play first.Play alternates between two players.

1)Swim
On your turn,you must
1.Choose one of your koies.
2.Choose a direction for the koi.
3.The koi keep swiming along the direction until it was blocked.

2)Stop
The koi must swim at least one point before stop, follow block can stop your koi:
A.Taiji
B.Koies of your side
C.Fryes of your side

3)Jump
As Koi love jump,the board edge can't stop it.If a koi swim to the board edge, it will jump over the board and dive into the edge of the other side and keep swim.

4)Forbidden
Your koi can't
A. Swim to touch koi of opposing side.
B. Swim along a direction that never meets a block.

Eat Fryes & Spawn Fryes 
Koi eat fryes of opposing family and spwan fryes of their own family.After the koi swim and stop:
A.Place fryes of your side onto The initial point of your koi and any blank point the koi swim over.
B.Flip over any opposing fry that may already be on points the koi swim over.
c.The final point of your koi remains without a fry, as a point can contain only a koi or a fry.

Game End
Game end and the player win if:
A.He place 14 fryes of his color on the board
or
B.Any koi of his opponent can't swim

Variant
Quick Mode
During Setup phase, both players set their koies as follwing positon

Customize Winning Condition
Players can set 15 or more fryes as wining number.

This is a variant to Grand Mastermind.

The player must discover a code of five elements of different colors and shapes. There are four different colors and six different shapes. You have 12 chances to discover the code.

The code-maker has three different pegs: white (correct color and correct shape), black (completely correct) and red (correct shape and correct position).

From the publisher:

Dolfje Weerwolfje is on an adventure with Boura, Timmie and Dad. They're looking for Grandpa Werewolf, who's never afraid of anything. But hunters tricked him and now he's locked in a chicken coop. Now you are either Dolfje Weerwolfje, Noura, Timmie or Dad and you're trying to save Grandpa Werewolf as quickly as you can. But of course, you have to transforn into a werewolf first! Be the first to release Grandpa Werewolf from his cell to win the game.

This is a game based on the popular books by Paul van Loon, about a little boy who's actually a werewolf. It's a simple 'roll and move', where cards replace the dice. The board is divided into day, twilight and night. During the day, players have to become werewolves. During the night, they have to find the items necessary to save Grandpa Werewolf. The 'twilight' part of the board serves as a second chance, where players can try to get the things they miss to finish either day or night.

name.value: Play-Doh Piepers in de puree spel

item.description:
From the back of the package

"Help! Save me from the Mash Machine! I used to be a simple spud on the farm, but now I'm trapped in a crazy kitchen and I need your help to escape in one piece! If I get crinkled, smashed, chopped or sliced by the Mash Machine, you'll need Mr. and Mrs. Potato Head to help make me a whole spud again. Help me get back to the farm quick before I become someone's side dish!"

Uh oh! Your little spud pals are in big trouble — they’re in the kitchen and they could be made into “food”. Mold potato pal pawns out of PLAY-DOH modeling compound and then use the spinner to move them across the board. But be careful of where you land, or else your spud buddy could get snipped, sliced, pressed into “fries” or cranked into “chips”. Help your pal get out of the kitchen and back to the farm first and you’re the winner! Includes gameboard (non-stick), 4 two-ounce cans of PLAY-DOH Brand Modeling Compound, spinner, 8 Mash Machine parts, 2 potato molds, 2 gameboard pegs and instructions.

Re-implements:

 The Grape Escape

item.description:
Québec puts you at the head of a rich family who wants to leave its name in history by building Québec city. The game spans four centuries during which you erect the most prestigious buildings and places of the city. Construction is not enough: you also have to ensure your presence in the great spheres of power. It is up to you and your opponents to build Québec City in your colors!

A game takes place over four centuries. Each player plays on average 5 to 7 turns per century. On each turn, players choose one of these actions :

 Start a new building with his architect
 Complete part of a building
 Send a worker to a zone of influence
 Take a leader card




By contributing to the numerous buildings, players acquire influence with the authorities of the time : religion, politics, commerce and culture. Players also help build the famous Citadelle.

At the end of each century, there is a scoring round where players get victory points for the workers they managed to send in the 5 zones of influence. Québec introduces a unique and addictive majority rule. The player with the majority in a zone cascades half of his workers by moving them to the next zone. Workers moved in this way allow a player to score even more points. If a player still has the majority in the next zone, his workers cascade again – a potentially devastating ripple effect. This mechanism illustrates the interrelationship between the great zones of influence. Players must not only fight to get majorities, they must also erect the most prestigious buildings.

The game ends after the fourth century. Players then receive points for the buildings they completed. The player with the most points is declared the winner.

Québec won the Plateau d'or 2007 and was shortlisted at the 2007 Boulogne-Billancourt International Designer Contest.

item.description: Auto Ambush! could be loosely described as a set collection game with an element of Slapjack. The goal of the game is to collect a set of 4 identical Hot Wheels rides; each player is limited to a hand of 4 cards, from which they simultaneously exchange any cards they wish from their hand, one card at a time, for any card on the table, including cards discarded by other players in the same round.

item.description:
The sister game to Junishi, 12 Moons and Zodiakos,
Neteru is an abstract strategy game inspired by the 12 signs of the Egyptian Zodiac. (Each player controls 6 of the 12 signs.)

The object of Neteru is to move one of your 6 pieces into your opponent's Gate, which is located at the opposite end of the board, in between your opponent's Spawn Areas.

Players begin at either end of a board comprised of 23 circles. 
At the start of the game there are not any pieces on the board. Any pieces that a player wishes to use must be "spawned" in one of the Spawn Circles on that player's side of the board. 
Players may move the pieces that they already have on the board either by moving them into adjacent circles or by jumping over friendly pieces.
Players also may use their animals to capture their opponent's animals by jumping over them.

Neteru is a simple and fast paced abstract strategy game that is easy to learn and usually plays in under 20 minutes. It comes in a little cloth bag that also serves as the game board
and it can be carried in any pocket that is big enough to hold a pack of gum.

Neteru is a complete game that can be expanded by combining it with its sister games Junishi, 12 Moons, and Zodiakos.
(source : the publisher)

Integrates with:

 12 Moons





 Junishi



 Zodiakos

Wi$eMoney is a fun learning game for students. It reduces lectures, puts teachers in a role to reinforce learning, and facilitates discussions on personal finance through problem-based learning to keep students involved and active.
Player teams compete by answering questions on banking, investing, budgeting, planning, financing, credit, and safety and identify protection and by making financial choices to distinguish between needs and wants.

Components:

 Game board
 Cards and game elements

This is a Dominoes variant with two ways of playing. The first one follows regular Dominoes rules: A player can play a tile on his/her turn which must match a tile to another tile at one end of the layout of tiles already on the table. If the player cannot do that with a tile s/he owns, s/he has to draw an additional tile. The first player to get rid of his/her tiles is the winner.

The playing pieces however, are irregularly shaped. For the second variant, the players put their pieces into a bag and have to feel which edge fits an edge of another piece. Other than that, the usual rules apply as well.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name.value: Tic Tac Boum: le jeu de cartes

item.description:
The active player first flips open a card that determines a category, then a letter card. S/he then has ten seconds to name a word that matches both cards. The next player flips open a new letter card and does the same, etc. A player who cannot find a word within the ten seconds has to keep the category card. The next player draws a new one. When someone draws a bomb card, all other players can pass a category card to him/her. When the exploding bomb card is drawn, the game ends after the current move and the player with least category cards is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

A push your luck with squirrels game for children! Each turn the active player throws 8 boxes. If none of the boxes fell with the open side up the player ends his turn. If he threw at least one box on it's open side up he puts the nut that was inside the box in front of him. Now he can either end his turn and gain all the nuts he has in front of him or risk and throw with all the remaining boxes. And now: if none of the boxes have their open side up - he loses all the nuts he put in font of him this turn. Otherwise he takes the nuts from the boxes with their open side up and once again decides whether he wants to risk another throw or gain all the nuts he has in front of him. The first player to gain 2 sets of 4 nuts in one colour wins!

Think Quick, Act Faster!

Will you be the first to say "Arrrr!" like a pirate when a circle appears? Or clap your hands at the sight of dots? Don't cheer "Hooray!" for a square though...that was last round.

Players take turns flipping over cards which show different shapes. Be the first to complete the correct action and you win that card! But watch out - each round shuffles the actions, and their matching shapes. You score a point for each card awarded, and at the end of the game the player with the most points wins!

Contains 24 action cards, 8 shape cards and 40 flip cards.

item.description:
Psiduel is an intense, psychological dueling game for two players. Players take the role of psionic test subjects, pitted against one another in an "experiment" only one of them can survive. It is visceral and fast; playable in under 15 minutes.

At the beginning of a game, each player prepares a grid consisting of six cards face down. This grid represents the player’s psionic defenses. The card backs display a number from one to three, letting the opponent know the strength of the defense, but not the type.

Each player has an offense and defense deck to draw from. During a round, players burn cards off the top of a deck in order to play cards from their hand, either to replenish their defenses or attack.

The object of the game is to destroy your opponent’s defenses, and reduce them to zero life by attacking unoccupied spaces on their grid.

72 cards (2 decks of 36, one for each player) and a simple rule sheet come in the box. No add-ons required.

Non-Stop Safari is a 2 to 4 player print and play board game submission to the 2011 Global Game Jam. Players take on the role of rich financiers who send hunters on safari to find valuable animal pelts. Only the rarest pelts will fetch the highest price, and you can’t get more rare than extinct! By hunting a species to extinction players can guarantee a high return on their precious pelts. Oh, and watch out for poachers, unless of course, they’re working for you!

The object of the game is to be the player with the most money by the end of the game. The game ends immediately after the third species has gone extinct. All pelts of this species are sold off as usual and then money totals are counted.

name.value: Sovereign: An open source board game project

item.description:
The main objective of the game is to collect seven of one type of victory card. Players must balance their play between researching technologies, expanding cities and building units. Having only a limited number of actions per turn, it is important for players to consider their activities carefully so that they maximize their ability to collect cards. The first player to collect seven of one type of victory card wins the game.

This game is based on hex-grid map boards and players can choose which sections of the map to assemble. Currently there are maps of Europe and the Caribbean, although plans for future maps will cover the entire world. Players lay tiles down to form cities and can build military units to protect them or attack others. Cities create the wealth that a player needs to further their empire.

Players take turns to perform their moves, building their empire up while keeping a close eye on their neighbors to prevent them beating them to the end. Open play allows players to watch other players activities, and manage resources in way that can stop other players winning while not hindering their own advancement.

The game has been designed to give flexibility to the rules so that players can develop in-house versions of the rules without breaking the game. One popular alteration is in the collection of cards. Players can change the speed and dynamic of the game by changing how many and of which types of card need to be collected.

The game is fully customizable allowing players to design their own versions including army units, maps, technologies and rules. The online published version of the game can be downloaded and printed off for free.

Released under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike licence.

name.value: Bio Grafo The Biography Game of Skill and Chance

item.description:
75 well-known authors and one work each is known for is the basis of this Bingo-type 'educational' game. Each player gets one of 40 'GRAFO' cards, a 5 by 5 grid where each square has an author number, an author's name, and his or her image. The caller randomly pulls from the stock of 75 tokens, and reads aloud the column letter (G, R, A, F, or O) and title of a play, book, poem, or short story and optionally the author number. If the author of that work is on his or her card, a player marks that square with a translucent disk, hoping to be the first to get five in a row. Can be played in three difficulty levels:

1) Playing by the numbers. The caller reads the column letter, title, and author number. This makes the game no harder than Bingo with some trivia thrown in.

2) Playing by the book. The caller omits the author number, but players have access to a "Bio/graphics" booklet in which they can find the author of the named work.

3) Playing for mastery. Players no longer have access to the book and have to recall from memory the author of the named work.

A player calls "Grafo" when he or she covers five squares in a row on his or her card, and once verified is declared the winner.

Milky Way Express is a Free Print-and-Play space trading and exploration game.

Game Summary
You start the game with a credit of $10 and your aim is to earn enough money throughout the game to pay back this loan when the game ends.
You will take turns moving your Spaceship on cards laid out as a chart of the Milky Way Galaxy, discovering new Planets as you go. You will throw dice to determine what goods will be on offer at each planet. Available goods will vary from turn to turn, so buy low and sell high while the market is friendly to you. But if luck abandons you, you may be driven to Bankruptcy by greedy Pirates and zealous Customs controls (if you dare to smuggle any illegal goods).
The game ends when you turn over the last unexplored card on the Galactic Chart, or when you run out of money.

This game is released under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License - that means you can use and modify the game for free, but you can't sell it or claim it as your own.

A game like soccer by Dieter Stein.

Gameplay

The game is played a certain amount of time (2 × 20 minutes are recommended). After the first half players change sides. The player scoring the most goals wins the game.

On each turn, firstly, a player throws the die. The number thrown represents moving and attacking points, which can be distributed freely among the football players (and/or the goalie) of the own team. Points can be used as moves or attacks.

Soccer teams are purchased separately, so that players can choose their favorites. Available teams are:

- Spain
- Brazil
- Germany
- France/Italy
- Portugal
- Netherlands
- Argentina
- England/Switzerland
- Australia/South Africa
- USA/Uruguay

item.description:
Jakten på guldmynten (The hunt for the goldcoins) is a dice game with characters from Disney, like Scrooge McDuck. You want to be the first player to achieve 10.000 points.

You roll 10 dices, and attempt to get dice with "pairs", like Donald, Daisy and Gladstone Gander (they have the same colour, red), you get a bonus, and also you can now roll the "coin-dice" trying to get a coin worth 1000 points. But without getting three dices with the faces of Beagle Boys. Dice with a star is a joker.

The game is similar to Monopoly Express.

When you get the urge to fish but can't launch the boat.... Here's the solution.

Anglin' Action is a game that involves matching fish with their correct location and lures. This allows a player to 'catch' the fish. All of the fish are assigned different values. 
The winner is the player with the most 'fish points' at the end of the game.

Playing the Game:

Deal five action cards to each player.
Pile the remaining Action Cards, Lure Cards and Location Cards at the side of the table.

There are three simple phases that make up a player's turn:

Draw Phase: Draw one card from the game deck
Action Phase: You may play an Action Card if you want. Simply follow th einstructions on the Action Card. Limit one per turn.
Fish Phase: On this phase a player may do ONE of three things:

Move to a location- Take a location card and place in front of you.
Put on a lure- Take a lure card from your tackle box and place in front of you.
Catch a fish- Take a fish from your hand that matches the correct lure and correct location you are in.

Afteryour fishing phase is over the next player goes.

Winning:

The game ends when any player has caught their limit of ten fish. At this point the winner is determined by the player with the most points. Therefore the player who caught ten fish may not necessarily be the winner of the game.

Killzone 2 is a cardgame made by a fan of the Playstation 3 game called Killzone 2. It's a two player game, for free on the web. One player takes control of ISA (human) army, the other player is Helghast. The goal is to destroy enemy. There are two 63-card decks. In the first round, every players draw 6 cards. If they have at least 2 basic cards (soldiers and shock troopers), the battle begin.In each round, player draws one card and heals character for 10 points. Every round you have 10 Action Points and you can use them to:

-attack
-place basic character in spawn point
-evolve character (example= soldier can evolve to any V1 character [medic, saboteur etc.] or in soldier v2)
-place vechiles
-equip weapons, tools
-use tools

You can have:

1 Active Character
5 Spawn Point Characters
Vechile, Weapon, Tool

If enemy haven't got any characters on spawn point or in active character place, you win!

name.value: Dungeons & Dragons: Conquest of Nerath Board Game

item.description:
From the publisher:

"War has come to the Dungeons & Dragons world! In the north, the undead legions of the Dark Empire of Karkoth march against the fragile League of Nerath, determined to sweep away the human kingdoms forever. To the south, the infernal Iron Circle launches its own goblin hordes in a campaign of conquest against the elves and corsairs of Vailin. From the snowy expanse of the Winterbole Forest to the sun-warmed coasts of ancient Vailin, four great powers struggle for survival."

Conquest of Nerath is a fantasy conquest game. 2-4 players muster armies of foot soldiers, siege engines, monsters, warships, elementals, and dragons to attack their opponents. Players employ heroes such as knights and wizards to lead their troops and explore dungeons in the search of magical artifacts and treasures to increase their power in combat.

link.value: Dungeons & Dragons: Conquest of Nerath Board Game – Sword of Kas Promo

item.description:
One player rolls five dice (each side of the die bearing a different color). The result is called "Geronimo". All players will ante chips into the pot. Each player will then ante another chip and then attempt to match the Geronimo. If three of the five dice match, he may reroll the remaining two. If one of the two match, he may then take a third roll of the remaining die. If the dice match the Geronimo, the player wins the pot. During play, other combinations of dice may win the player lesser rewards from the pot.

The game is over when the pot is exhausted and the winner has the most chips.

The Land of Lo’en is vast. Its Kingdoms and Guilds are populated by Humans, Elves, Dwarves, Goblins, Kobolds, Trolls, and of course, the Dragons. The Dragon King is dead now and you, as one of his many overlooked offspring, have decided that it’s time for a change.

Can you raise the funds to bribe the dragon clans to join your coup and the food to keep them? Can your strength convince the citizens of Lo’en to support your claim to the throne? Can your followers influence the diverse Kingdoms’ many Guilds and Clan Houses, and use their powerful resources to aid your cause?

Your siblings have dynastic plans of their own and the dead King’s influence, though weakening, must still be reckoned with. There will be many obstacles to surmount in your quest to claim the Dragon Throne.

Princes of the Dragon Throne is an area control and resource management board game that uses deck building as a driver for the other game elements. Players select cards from a continually changing pool of opportunities to build a unique deck of recruits. Players manage resources to support their uprising, and use the influence of their recruits to gain control of the various Guilds of the Kingdoms, which in turn gives them special abilities to further their cause.

Clever Mojo Games has contracted with Don Aguillo, an amazing talent with card game art experience, to create 120 new original artworks for Princes of the Dragon Throne and our card design format will highlight Don’s art in a bold and beautiful manner.

name.value: Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum

item.description: Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum official trivia board game! Test your rock and roll knowledge and travel 86 spaces to become the first player to reach the Hall of Fame. Includes over 1,700 questions and clues about the greatest people, events, recordings and dates in rock and roll history!

The golden age of sail was funded by the mighty trade fleets of the World’s nations. In this card game you will control a fleet of ships, trying to amass as much gold as possible.

Collect goods and when you have enough trade them in at a port. Maybe you want to waylay other captians with dock fees or get them lost? Remeber, the pirates weren't the riches men on the seas, the traders were.

Players have several different play options each turn including playing a card, playing a port or redeeming goods. By redeeming goods at a port players earn gold which is required to win the game.

name.value: Scene It? Disney Magical Moments Deluxe Edition

item.description:
This Scene it - Disney Magical Moments Deluxe Edition uses trivia, movie clips, and puzzles from classic Disney and Pixar films. Unlike previous Scene-it games, Magical moments uses 160 trivia cards and a sketch pad in addition to the interactive DCD in order to add new dimensions of entertainment. Act, describe, and draw comedy movie hints as you move around the game board and see or hear hints from the DVD. If you win your challenge, you move again. However, if you lose your challenge, your opponents have their chance to move around the board. Get their questions right to steal their turn! Overcome three challenges once you reach the Final Cut and you win the game!

Also included are features that randomize clips for every game and that allow the variability of game time.

And this game isn't just about movie clips and trivia. Your deduction and observation skills will be needed to overcome on-screen challenges. Additional content such as minigames and other bonus activities add to the fun even when not playing the game itself.

A simple push-your-luck dice game, Dragon Egg Omelet (or Omelette, depending on where one lives) tasks players with searching dragon nests to collect eggs required in a very rare omelet for an ornery king (with quite a specific culinary palate).

Try to gather the necessary dragon eggs before the other players without rousing the adult dragons who guard those eggs.

Components: 6 dice, 40 dragon eggs, instructions, portable carrying case.

Gameplay involves rolling sets of dragon eggs (pips) with the dice, avoiding the faces that display dragons, and pushing your luck to gain eggs and decide whether to continue rolling for more eggs or play it safe and quit for the round.

name.value: Dice BattleShips with Land n Air 07

item.description:
The game is played on a board like a large chess board, The game board included is just an example You make a board to suit the battle.

The pieces are regular dice d6. The are three different colors that represent Navy (blue), Army (green), Air Force (white). As you play your troops will suffer casualties , You rotate the dice to reduce the strength of a piece.

The object of the game is to control the board, or to eliminate the enemy. You move your troops by aiding each other -- Navy can transport Army, Air Force planes can air-lift Army, Air Force planes can land on carriers, et c.

Game-play is simply
When a unit is adjacent to an enemy unit in your turn you may attack, an attack is resolved by adding all the strengths of the attacking units in the battle, then subtracting the combined enemy strength to reach a positive or negative battle-score. The attacker and defender roll a d6 for further support and add or subtract the numbers from the battle-score total. A positive result allows the attacker to reduce the enemy force by that number, and a negative battle-score allows the defending player to do the same.

At the beginning of every turn, a d6 is rolled, this gives the current player one of six combat advantages:
1) bomb any land unit and reduce by 2.
2) move any unit by 3
3) add 1 to every combat this turn
4) build a friendly airfield , next to ant land unit
5) fighter attack reduce any plane unit by 2
6) hide any unit for 2 turns

The game also includes optional rules for mines.

Based on the wily and compelling BBC TV quiz show, this game brings all the best features straight from the studio to your living room. How it works... Each question has been given to a group of 100 people who are asked to give as many correct answers as they can within 100 seconds. Questions are list based and will have numerous possible answers. Any correct answer given that none of the 100 people remembered would, therefore, be worth zero points - these are Pointless answers and are the holy grail for players in Pointless. Who will carry off the Pointless 'Trophy' amongst your family and friends.

For example, if the question asks you to name a film starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Titanic is not a good answer as 88 people in the survey gave this. Anybody who says The Man in the Iron Mask gets a much better score of 6 points.

item.description:
From the back of the box:

"Take control of WWE!

Experience a revolution in DVD game play with a new level of interaction between players. Manage the ultimate roster and prepare for unpredictable action as the on-screen General Manager calls the shots. Features incredible 3D graphics, authentic video footage, photos of Superstars and Legends, and unlimited game play"

Object of the game is to collect 4 of the 7 Championship Titles. Each Superstar can only hold one Title at a time. You need 4 Superstars to win the game.

Game-play is roll and move. Roll a die, move that many spaces clockwise, follow the instructions in the space you land, mostly by clicking the corresponding button in the DVD to find out if you have a match, an on-screen challenge or special choice.

Re-implements:

 WWE DVD Board Game (2nd Edition)

Hilarious party game for 5-10 adult players. No matter what the truth is Revelations will reveal the sins, but exactly who the sinners are will remain stricly private! You should expect to have some hilarious and lively discussions as you try to work out how many of your friends have, for example, been caught shoplifting.

The object of this game is to guess the number of your fellow players who have commited each "sin" but exactly who has commited the sin will remain a secret! This game is not really suitable for children as some of the questions are a little on the risky side....but it will provide hours of amusing fun for groups of open minded adults and is a superb party game!

Board game based on the popular -ology series of books

Your name is Joshua T. Kraik and you run a private detective agency in London, 1920. Recently you received a letter from a dying friend requesting your help on a mission that will take you to the four corners of the world in search of the pieces of a lost artifact - The Sword Of Angels.

Set sail and collect the missing shards of the sword in this thrilling board game of survival, where you will discover the terrifying story of the Vampires. The future of mankind relies on the successful retrieval of the sword which, when pieced back together, will destroy vampires for all eternity. Be prepared, the task is great and time is against you!

Players aim to collect the 4 shards of The Sword of Angels to eliminate all vampires everywhere.

One player is secretly (to begin with) a rogue vampire and it is his/her aim to turn all the other players into vampires once his/her true identity is discovered.

item.description:
Manufacturer's Description:
The aim of the game is to be the first one to roll and play your way to Purple Ronnies place at the centre of the board. In order to do this players move round the board and depending what square they land on have to engage in several Purple Ronnie activities. There are two pack of cards in the game - called Words and Games. The word cards include chat-up lines - what would be your response to various cheesy chat up lines, Tongue Twisters, Poems - make up a poem with either the first or last line gives and corny cracker jokes to make you groan! The games cards include Charades, Half-a-minute - talk for 30 seconds or more on a subject without hesitating, trivia questions - questions about Ronnies or the colour purple and dares - how to make a fool of yourself without really trying! This game is bound to get any party off to a cracking start and also works well as a family game for players aged 18 or over.

Manufacturer's Description:
The hilarious game of noisy Charades. Can you identify the noise of a car while rocking on your heels or the sound of a piano while blindfold and standing on one leg?

Players must try to get one member of the group to identify as many noises as possible before the timer runs out. It's not as easy as it sounds when each player has to adopt a silly position like standing on one leg, for example.

Number of players: 3–4

Object of the game: Have enough control of player-colored disks on the outer rings of the board to draw them into the inner ring. First to 4 disks of his or her color (out of 7) on the inner ring wins...

Equipment: Each player is a color. Choose a color to be neutral. Players need: The board, 10 disks per player (separate into 7 and 3), a figure for each player, 6 bars of a neutral color (separate into 3 and 3), 9 disks of the neutral color, the figure of the neutral color, the gray figure, and the deck (without trilithon cards).

During a player’s turn, he has 1 of 3 actions that he can take:

- Move as many neutral disks from a single inside cup. Take the disks into your hand. You will replace them after taking an action or two. For each disk taken in hand, you may move a component in the corresponding section to the left or right 1 space. You may move any component even if it is not your color. You may use multiple energy disks to affect a single component or spread them out as you wish. You may move the component into a new section, but cannot continue to affect it this turn (since it is in a different section, and disks from a certain cup only affect the corresponding section).

If you a place component onto a spot that is occupied, the component on the spot is moved either left, right, in, or out 1 space as per your choice (no more out than the outer track, no more in than the inner track. Again, it is possible to push a component to another section). It is possible that moving the component pushes it into another occupied space, in which case, repeat the above process until there is no conflict.

After using all disks in a cup that you want, take the disks that are in the hand and place them into different cups that the one they originated from. You may place the disks into inside OR outside cups, and you can split them up as you choose (all in one cup or split into multiple cups, etc.). This is supposed to represent energy conversion, which is necessary for casting a spell

- Move as many outside energy disks as you want (regardless of the section they are in). Likewise, take them into hand first, and after taking an action per disk, replace them in different cups than the one(s) from which they originated.

For each disk moved, you may move your figure, the neutral figure, or the gray figure 1, 5, or 20 spaces in either direction as long the figure is in the section the disk was in. You may use multiple disks on a single figure (i.e., move a figure 20 spaces using a disk in one cup, and then another 2 spaces using 2 disks from a different cup. If you move the figure onto a space occupied by another figure, both figures simply occupy the same spot (nothing special).

That’s movement, but you can also move components using the outer cups. If yours, the neutral’s, or the grey figure is on the inner track on the same space as a component, you may use an energy disk from an outside cup to pull the component in 1 space, or push it out 1 space. If you push/pull a disk into another, the disk is displaced as described above. If a disk is pulled down to the inner track, it gets pulled to the space the figure is on

- Take any 2 neutral disks and put them into your hand. You may take these 2 from the same or different cups. Just before your next turn, place them in any cup or cups of your choice.

For recap, the 3 actions are: a) take as many energy disks from a single inside cup, b) take as many energy disks as you want from outside cups, or c) take 2 disks off the board for a turn.

As a special bonus, if a component of your color gets to the inner track, you may place one of your 3 extra disks on any cup of your choice. This counts as a disk that only you may use. When you use it, move it as any other disk in a cup. Also, once a component is on the inner track, it cannot be moved and no other component may move to that spot. Figures may ignore it for the sake of movement, and just move on top of it or through it.
Ending the Game

When a player has gotten 4 of the 7 components into the inner track, he casts the spell, and thus wins. For a shorter game, play to 3 of the 7 components.

Number of players: 2

Object of the game: The object of pwn_Henge is to "capture" your opponent's disks by moving one of your pieces onto a space occupied by his or her piece(s).
Getting Started

Equipment: Cards (trilithon cards removed)
10 disks of a color for each player
The game board

Playing the Game

Players must first randomly determine which player will go first as this is a turn based game. Players each draw a card from the deck. The card having the highest value determines which player goes first. If both players draw cards of the same value, the day card beats the night card.
The goal of PWN-Henge is to remove all of your opponent’s pieces from the board by capturing them with your own and be the last man standing. To capture an opponent’s disk, you must one of your pieces to that space. There are two methods for doing this:

Players may move their disks into adjacent spaces:
This may be done even if the target space is unoccupied.
This results in the defending player losing his or her piece(s.)

If a player moves his or her disk onto a space with two or more disks, the “defending” player will lose all of those pieces.

Players may draw a card:
Players may move to the space indicated on the card.
Players may move into occupied or unoccupied spaces.

Players may also move a disk in the exact amount of spaces (in either direction) of the drawn card’s value.
Players may only make one move per turn and may move any of their own pieces in that turn. If a player draws a card, he or she must play it or pass. Played cards go into a discard pile. If the deck runs out before gameplay has ended, players must re-shuffle the deck and place it face down in the middle of the board.
Ending the Game

Once a player has removed his or her opponent's pieces from the board, the game ends and the last man standing is the winner.

Game Rules

Number of players: 3–5

Object of the game: The first player to have his color disk atop the majority of trilithons in play is the winner. That would be 2 trilithons in a 3 player game, 3 in a 4 player game etc..

Equipment: The game board. The neutral (grey) figure. One Trilathon per player. The entire card deck.
Each player will need:
A player figure. 10 corresponding colored bars. Enough corresponding colored disks to top the majority of trilithons in play.

Whoever has the most bars of any color has sway over a trilithon. Each player began with a trilithon because they had more bars of their own color than anyone else.
If at any time a player has more of an opponent's color bars than any other player, he/she replaces that player's color disk with his/her own atop a trilithon.
When ever one player has his/her disks atop the majority of trilithons that player wins.

In a time long past, the mystical energies of Stonehenge were incredibly strong. The concentrated magic attracted demons from another plane of existence. The priests of an ancient people wished to protect their sacred place and devised a way to create a barrier that, once completed, would keep the demons at large. They also summoned spirits of Nature to help in their fight. The priest who worked best to protect Stonehenge was destined to rule.

Game Rules

Number of players: 3–4

Object of the game: Score the most points by defeating demons and surrounding Stonehenge with a magical barrier.

Getting Started

Equipment: The board, the trilithons, the card deck, the neutral figure (dark priest), the player figures (priests), disks and bars. Required extra material: six spirits of Nature in each player color, twelve demons in a neutral color, and six demon appearance markers (use pawns and wooden cubes from other games, for example).

The game ends when the last moving demon is defeated or successfully attacks a trilithon or the altar stone. A final scoring takes place. First, each player loses 3 points per demon at their respective trilithons. The single player with most defeated demons scores 3 points. Each wall segment on the board is worth 1 point for the respective players. The player with most points wins. If there is a tie, the winner is the tied player with most spirits on the board.

name.value: Krimi Total Fall 7: Die Party der Intrigen

item.description:
General info on "Krimi Total": Murder mystery game in which players act out their role and try to solve the mystery.

Info on this particular case: A group of very young and very successful people (estate agent, bestseller author, actor, pop star, designer, professional boxer, model, exchange student) are invited to a party at a luxurious mansion to celebrate their success stories. Then one of their friends is found dead. What happened? Who is the murderer? This is what the players try to find out through discussions and deduction. The murderer is allowed to lie, all the others have to tell the truth about their characters if asked for information.

In "Party der Intrigen" there are 8 obligatory roles (can't be played with less than 8): 4 male, 4 female. One optional role, the inspector, can be either male or female.

Manufacturer's Description:
First roll the 2 large dice. Then you need to add, subtract, divide or multiply the 2 numbers shown. Then flip up the appropriate key, first one to flip up all 10 keys wins.

In Atlantis Rising you are one of the citizens of the stricken island Atlantis. However, hope is not lost, a mystical portal of 10 components can be built and save the island and all its inhabitants, but fail to build it in time and the island will sink forever under the waves, lost to legend.

Atlantis Rising is a fully co-operative game in which the players must race to create a cosmic gate before all of the island tiles have been destroyed. The gate's components are variable and determine the difficulty level of the game - Easy, Normal, Hard, or Cosmic. The players must also contend with the continually escalating threat of their Athenian enemies, who may destroy one or more island tiles each turn if insufficient Atlanteans are allocated to the island's protection.

Each turn players can choose to place their Atlanteans in any of eight different areas - with placements closer to the sea being more rewarding, but subject to a higher risk of flooding (and the subsequent loss of the associated action).

After placement of meeple but before gaining resources 'misfortune' cards are drawn per player indicating which areas of the island sink, any meeple stood there have a long swim back to shore and do nothing for their turn.

Players have limited 'mystical energy' which they can use to predict or prevent certain misfortunes and cards are available from the libraries that offer powerful one time use effects.


From the back of the box:

Will you send your Atlanteans to mine the untapped veins of precious resources at the very tip of the island, hoping to reap great rewards before the oncoming waves smash into the shores? Or will you remain in the relative safety of the island’s center, where resources have grown scarce? Perhaps you will tap into the power of the mystic energy source - the lifeforce of Atlantis and key to its advanced technology. You may even seek refuge in the vast libraries of the Lost City, hoping to find some tome which will lead to salvation for the doomed isle. Beware though - even as the island sinks into the sea, the Athenians continue to assault Atlantis, hoping to plunder its riches before it disappears beneath the waves.

item.description:
Starts With is a fantastic "what do words begin with" game. 
The object of the game is to complete your category list as quickly as possible. Your category list might contain such categories as boys names, musicians or countries and you spin the spinner to select a letter. The aim is then to find a word in that category that starts with that letter...boys names begining with S (not too hard) or musicians beginning with E (a bit harder).

The object of the game is to guess the real description of a word from the actual answer and other players bluffs. Each player takes a Bluff sheet amd writes their initials in the name space. One player is the reader for each round and they take a question card and select a word from it. The other players al write down a Bluff description of the word and the reader writes the true definition. The reader then reads all definitions out and each player has to try and guess the true definition of the word. Each player who correctly guesses the true definition scores a point and at the end of the round the next player becomes the reader. The most points at the end of a specified number of rounds is the winner. The game is presented in a smart tin with a bevelled edge and a plastic insert and is shrink wrapped for further protection.

The object of the game is to describe a word for your team to guess without saying any of the forbidden words. Players divide into two teams and decide on a time limit for each round. Team A selects a player to give them the clues for a word printed on their word card. The player picks a card and places it in the holder so that they and Team B can see it but team A (the players team) can't. They then try to describe the word on their card without using any of the forbidden words. If one of the forbidden words is used and Team B spot it Team A don't score and play passes to team B. If team A correctly guess the word they score a point. The team with the most points wins.

Components:

 40 x Word cards
 Team score pad
 Card holder
 Rules

The object of the game is to correctly answer questions in specific categories. Firstly set a time limit for the game or decide to play for a certain number of cards. The first player spins the spinner to determine which category of question they should answer on that turn. The Random Choice space on the spinner means the player can choose a category. The player to their left then takes a card from the question pile and asks the question, if guessed correctly the player marks it down on their score pad and gets another question. Once they answer wrongly play passes to the next player.

The object of the game is to act out the words from your cards to your team and see how many they can guess. Players divide into teams and decide on a time limit for each mime. The first player from team A takes a mime card and spins the spinner, they then try to act out the words on that category card to their team, each correct guess wins a point.

When Barbarossa begins, the world will hold its breath! - A. Hitler

So, why did Barbarossa fail? The ATO Annual edition for 2010 includes four game modules in one package. Four veteran designers combine in a unique offering from Against the Odds... and each have drawn some startling conclusions about what really happened, modeling with four very different approaches. "Four Roads" offers four complete simulations that will provide hours of challenging play and comparison.

Prados' contribution is subtitled "Codeword: Barbarossa" and covers June 1940 - June 1941, with an emphasis on the political lead-up to the campaign. Each of the other three modules cover June 1941-March 1942. Raicer gives us "Hitler Turns East" - Rinella "Slaughterhouse" - and Nord "Strike the Bear."

Played on four full color 17"x22" mapsheets, each module lasts up to 3 to 4 hours, so 12-16 hours to play them all.

item.description:
Wargame is a strategy game for 2 players. Playing time is roughly 20 minutes.

Each player has 13 cards ranked from 13 (Bazooka) down to 1 (Spy). Cards of a higher rank typically take cards of a lower rank, though there are some exceptions (Spies, for example, take both the Bazooka and the Mortar, while Shooters can sometimes be "turned").

A player first deploys his cards by placing them, 1 and 2 at a time, into the 13 spaces on his line. Once all cards have been deployed, players take turns advancing their cards into the combat zone.

What makes the game interesting is the ability for players to switch two cards before advancing one into battle. Each player can do this exactly 5 times.

The goal is to win 7 of the 13 battles in the combat zone, or win 4 adjacent battles. The winner will almost always be the player who most skillfully utilizes his troops, as there is very little luck involved.

Race around the track, balancing speed and control, in this quick, free, print and play game for 2-3 players.

Each chariot consists of two dice, representing the speed and health of the chariot. Every turn players must decide between speeding up, slowing down, or attacking. The faster you go, the greater you risk uncontrolled movement. Players must navigate the track to avoid running up against the walls, crashing into other players or running over debris from previous races. The goal is to be the first to make it to the finish line, but in some races this will simply mean being able to survive to the end.

Your flagship has wandered into uncharted space and you've suddenly detected an unknown vessel with its weapons readied and shields raised! Will you be able to survive the encounter?

GalaXism (guh-lax-iz-um) is a starship combat game for 2-6 players that should take about an hour to play. Players control the flagships of ten different races, playing their cards as increases to shields, weapons, defenses, and various other ship statistics.

Cards are laid out around a flagship, each section corresponding to a different side of the ship from forward, aft, starboard, and port. In addition, there's the command deck where the ship is controlled. The upgrade cards have 4 icons each and are shifted up, left, right, and up-right to reveal more icons during the game.

This game is heavily influenced by Innovation but taken in a different way.

I have separated the rules from the components to make it easier on me to update the rules. This also makes the download smaller when there are changes to the rules so that you don't have to worry about printing out new components.

Current Rules: http://www.lyonesse.info/games/download.php?filename=GalaXism.pdf

Current Components: http://www.lyonesse.info/games/download.php?filename=GalaXism-Components.pdf

Discussion Thread: http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/614464/wip-galaxism-a-quick-print-and-play-design-chall

Bottle-caps is a traditional game originating from the beginning of 20th century. It's probably the ancestor of the Pitch Car game. It uses crown bottle-caps to simulate a race. In its early days it was a cart race, now it usually is a car race. It can be played on a table, on a floor or outdoors.

Players start from making the race track. Depending on the environment they may draw it on a big sheet of paper, arrange it using available objects like books, boxes, tools, etc, draw it with a piece of chalk on a flat surface, or even cut it with a knife on the ground. For some game events the tracks were specially designed and made of gypsum.

Then each player takes his or her bottle-cap, and puts it at the start line. To make the caps heavier they are usually filled with candle wax, gypsum, plasticine, clay, or even lead (for outdoor races only). The race begins then and the players - in appropriate order - finger-flick their bottle-caps towards the finish line, avoiding their "cars" getting out the track or stopping on trap areas that require players to go back, miss a turn etc.

item.description:
The fast talking description game enhanced game play, new categories and electronic random timer!

Teams compete to be the first round the board by guessing words that their team-mates describe during turns that vary in length.
Team called DESCRIBER take a card and describe the entry
corresponding to the segment on which their playing piece sits.
When one of the team GUESSERS shouts out the correct answer the DESCRIBERS quickly take another card and repeat the process using the same category. When the timer runs out, the turn is finished, scoring take place and turn goes to next team.

The first team to land on or pass the FINISH segment WINS.
The ENTERTAINMENT category on the Finish segment is used if players decide beforehand that they want a longer game and play two circuits.

Players must not:
Say what letter the word starts with or how many letters it contains. Say the word itself or any derivative e.g. If the
word is ‘Post’ you may not say ‘Postage’ or if it is ‘Swim’ you may not say ‘Swimmer’ 
Players may:
Gesticulate, act or mime (but not by mouthing words).

Components:

 Electronic Timer
 400 cards
 Playing Board
 4 Playing Pieces
 Bonus Dice

With it's voice changing, fart sounding, wildly giggling electronic microphone - Don't laugh is the ultimate joke telling board game. The more players that laugh the more you score!

It's the game that will have you in stitches...but be careful...cos laughing makes you lose!!! The don't laugh board game offers interactive fun for all the family, so it's sure to be a popular game this Christmas...Each player in turn reads out a joke and then uses one or more sound effects to push the other poker-faced players over-the-edge and into fits of laughter and giggles!You get to move forward one space for every opponent who laughs...or who even cracks the slightest smile!Armed with over 1,000 jokes and a voice changing, fart sounding electronic microphone...the Don't Laugh board game is simple, straight faced, side splitting fun for all! It's the laugh-out-loud joke game, with farting, belching and cackling...but whatever you do.

In this exciting game you must race around Stilesville collecting Bratz autographs. On each turn, the 'Local Star Radio' tells you where the Bratz have been seen. But can you get to the Bratz before they move again? The first fan to collect all four autographs wins the game and collects the 'Winner's Medal'.

A miniatures game where players play colossal creatures and human-sized kaijin monsters such as Scarecrows, Werewolves, and Zombies as well as huge monstrous creatures (think Godzilla) in a battle to the last remaining creature.

Each player with have a sheet detailing their monster, it's characteristics and attributes. Using a custom d10 system, the players will battle each other using various attribute modifiers. This is a 28mm scale skirmish game where human (and humanoid creatures) are 28mm and and monsters are up to 14" tall.

Four favorite games for children:

Footballmatch - Just like in a real football game two teams try to defeat one another by scoring the highest possible number of goals within a set course of time.

Ring Game - An easy, but very attractive game of dice by which each player tries to claim rings of the same color from the starting points of his opponents and saves them up at his own starting point. Luck at throwing the oracular die and the tactics at choosing the colored rings ensure diversified and exciting rounds. The first player who manages to place 3 rings of the same color on his starting point wins the game.

Cat and Mouse - An asymmetric game where one player plays the cat, and the rest of the players (up to 4 others) control the mice. The cat wins when she is able to capture all mice. The mice win when one mouse succeeds at arriving at the winning point.

Car Race - A game of dice for 2 to 4 players from the age of 6 on. Players take turns rolling and moving up according to the number on the dice.

With Colorino, your child learns to identify and combine the basic colors. The pieces have been specially created for children 2 years and up, and are easy to use!

The game is to complete the drawings with corresponding buttons -- fixing them in the right place on the support. It allows your child to enjoy the primary and secondary colors. A fun way to develop his abilities association, handling, creativity and memorization!

How to play:

 Choose an illustrated board -- either the color side, or black and white.
 Place the chosen design underneath the transparent support.
 Complete the colored image with the corresponding color buttons, fixing them in the right place on the support
 Complete the black and white images with the color buttons of your choice, or try to memorize the color-side.




Contents: 1 transparent support, 6 image sheets (color on the front, black and white on the back), 40 color button pieces: red, blue, yellow, green, purple and orange.

Aether Captains: Pirates and Traders, a solitaire game (20-30 min) in which you play the captain of the freeship Swiftwind. As a trader and mercenary, you will buy and sell goods, brave the natural elements, and skirmish with dread air pirates over the skies of Arkady’s Grand Compact, the city-states of the Empire.

To win you must manage your zeppelin resources: engine components, your loyal crew, your weapons,and your cache of gold while completing 3 game Scenarios involving buying and selling trade goods, fighting Air Pirates and visiting cities and waystations. If ever 2 kinds of your resources stored in the sections of your zeppelin (Gold, Weapons, Crew, and Engine) fall to zero you have lost the game.

During the setup you will create a 4 tile Zeppelin to carry your resources and provide defense against attack. Various captains may be chosen from as well to give you some bonuses during the game.

Scenarios are then turned over followed by cards from the action deck. Each action is resolved with a set of numbers contained on the cards. Some cards allow you to visit cities and buy and sell trade goods plus other resources, other cards involve storms which may damage your ship and its cargo, pirates who will attack you in battle and various helpful cards like trading posts and waystations.

In this Print and Play game, 4 pages of rules include a player reference sheet to the cards need to be printed along with 56 full color cards. Additional materials required: 1d12, 40 markers in 4 colors (10 markers to a color) and some way to keep track of gold.

item.description: The objective of the game is to leave from home to one of four destinations and return to "Home Sweet Home" safely. There are four places and/or destinations that one may travel: playground, mall, school, playmate's house. In order to make the trip without being delayed, you must correctly answer a series of questions. Correct answers are highlighted with the category color. The player who returns home first with the correct answers is the winner!

In Dragon Face, you must capture the opponent's Emperor to win. Each player starts the game with one Emperor (which moves like a King in Chess), six Ambassadors (which move like a Queen) and seven Governors (who move straight or diagonally forward one square at a time).

Players alternate turns. If you jump an opponent's piece, you capture it, flipping the piece so that it shows your color. That piece now belongs to you and can be moved by you on subsequent turns. Capture the opponent's Emperor, and you win. (The playing area is a 9x7 space with the pieces starting in the back two rows on each side. You can move a piece into the "Sacrifice Zone" – the exterior ring surrounding the playing space – in order to make a capture. Governors that do so remain out of play for the rest of the game, while an Ambassdor can be brought back into play by moving a Governor to the opponent's back line.)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Super Dungeon Explore (SDE) is a dungeon crawler inspired by old Japanese console RPGs. The 52 included miniatures are done in a cute / chibi / super-deformed style, which means the head is roughly the same size as the rest of the body.

One to five players take the role of classic fantasy heroes like the human paladin, a dwarf fighter, or an elf ranger. One player is the "Dark Consul" who controls the monsters of the dungeon. Every hero/monster has a character card that details the stats for movement, attack, armor, willpower, dexterity, action points and hearts (= life points). Additional information may include special abilities / actions / attacks and potions.

The game is played on modular dungeon boards. During a round of play, the game passes back and forth between single heroes and the monsters, but the exact order may change from round to round. The characters use the stats from their character card, special dice (with hearts, potions and stars) are only used for combat and checks. If the heroes wound the opponent, they may draw loot cards to improve their stats. There is also the possibility to open treasure chests to find even more powerful things. The monsters have no possibility to "level up" apart from a single late game upgrade but the Dark Consul has an unlimited number of them.

To win the game, the Dark Consul must defeat all heroes in his dungeon. The heroes must spawn the dungeon boss by killing monsters or destroying all spawning points (= entry points for new monsters). The heroes must then kill the dungeon boss to be victorious.

item.description:
Treason is a 2 players game. Each participant will build up its influence in a medieval town, ultimately, resulting in the deposition of the king. As the game progresses intrigue, allegiances, conspiracy, combat, cunning and treason occur.

You must allure strong allies to your hand by doing successful quests for them; or buy favours of some society members in order to sabotage your competitor’s game. Do business with witches, knights, thieves, assassins, merchants and many other society members. Secretly conspire against your opponent. Acquire items to increase the chances of achieving success in quests or create unexpected setbacks to your opponent. The player who ends the game with the largest number of influence points (gained either by doing tasks or by performing dirty jobs) is the one that will take the King’s throne and wins the game.

No matter your background or social status, victory is only a step away.

Game play

In this game, the players draw cards from several decks – tasks, allies/quest, influence/conspiracy and store decks. The accumulation of influence is of extreme importance and the players will do this by performing assignments, dictated by tasks cards. This will increase their coins and reputation. They also have the possibility of either using their character’s skills to perform quests for members of society, by drawing quest cards, or machinate evil plans against its opponents, by drawing cards from a conspiracy deck. There’s also the possibility of buying items that will aid players perform quests by adding bonus points to base character skills, such as combat points and services that will allow to affect dramatically the other player’s game.

During a turn, each player will follow a stream of steps originated by the cards drawn from each deck. Luck and careful planning work hand in hand in this game.
 Goal
 The game’s goal is to increase one’s influence in this medieval society and alluring powerful allies. Players will accumulate influence (see above) by perfoming honest tasks, dirty jobs for important members of society and attracting allies to your cause. Ultimately the King’s deposition will happen as soon as he is stripped of social, military and political support.

"Toste"-Spiel KREUZ-JUNGE!

The curious and multi-purpose game of all games. Educational, funny and exciting!

The game contains 6 wooden dice with playing cards symbols + numbers and special instructions like "roll again". And a rulebook with some games:

Yes and No (answer-game): If you need a answer (Yes or no) roll the special dice unless the 35(Yes) or 36(No) appears. or you roll "Try again" or "Don't roll again, today"

For the "Orakel zu Delphi" roll all dice and compare the numbers with the table in the rulebook.

The other 8 games from the rulebook can be played with more players. The games called: Kreuz-Junge, Wettspiel, Farbenkrieg, Monte Carlo, Wohnung gesucht, Die gute Sieben, Jagd nach dem Glück, Königsjagd.

The object of all those games are to roll the most points, the games varies from how those points are made. For example in the game "Die gute Sieben" all the Ace counts (One Ace is 10, 2 Ace are 100, 3 Ace are 500 and 4 Ace are 1000 points) All players roll 5 rounds and the one with the most points win. 
The game "Monte Carlo" uses the numbers on the dice. All rolled even numbers counts 10, all other 0, a series of 3 numbers ( 1-2-3 or 17-18-19) counts 100 points. The player who reaches 500 points first wins.

Rebel Minis is proud to announce our newest game! This is another great game designed by Ed Teixiera for us. The 15mm Raptorz Game contains all the figures, map and rules you need to play a Raptorz invasion. Using the award winning Chain Reaction System by Two Hour Wargames, the game allows players to hunt Raptorz in a fully modular corridor system. Each box contains 12 raptorz 6 Homeguard Marines.

With purchase you will also be able to download the rules AND the Space Corridor System. This system, designed by Paper Make It ! is a full color Modular System. This pdf contains all you need to create your space base in just seconds after printing the many tiles available.

Here you will find Corridors from 1x1 to 1x10, L-T-X Joints and several rooms from 3x3 to 8x5 all in a 20mm grid! There is also a room with a big entrance can be used as Hangar.

If you own Shuffler from Paper Make It !, you can easily modify all the tiles and get a never ending variety in dimension and colors!

name.value: Ferris Bueller's Day Off Board Game

item.description:
Tongue-in-cheek board game designed by artist, Max Dalton. Similar to Candyland, but re-themed for a Ferris Bueller universe. Retro chic pop culture rolled up in one.

The object of the game is to travel along the path through dice-roll results from field 1 (which is marked as START) to HOME. The first player who successfully lands exactly on HOME is the winner. Many fields have special hazards or benefits for players who land on them.

name.value: The Little Big Game of Shmoozel

item.description:
Players are dealt a hand of ten cards, each of which is a letter of the alphabet worth a number of points (there are also a few wild cards). Players try to empty their hands by spelling five-letter (or longer) words using their letter cards. They can also add letters to their own previously played words (although they cannot rearrange the letters): for example, adding S, ED, or ING to WRECK.

Each turn players draw two cards and must discard one. Players may also take letters from the discard pile, but these must be used immediately -- and all discards prior to the one they take must be taken into their hand.

A round ends when a player goes out by spelling a word plus having one card to discard. Points from exposed words are totaled; points from letters held in the hand are subtracted unless they can be dumped into words (which are worth nothing).

A complete game consists of four rounds. Highest point total is the winner. Note: spelling SHMOOZE is worth 50 points and spelling SHMOOZELED is worth 250 points -- a bit of a balance wrecker.
